heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 08 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.4°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.9°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 8.3°C), dew point temperature (up 6.1°C), outside temperature (up 7.8°C), and cloud levels (up 519 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 186.7m lower than yesterday, 390.7m lower than the past week, 519.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 696m to a maximum of 1841m, averaging 1068.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1458.7m and 1587.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (4.4°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
